channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road near roundabout damaged, 3rd June
item.description:
Hello, The road at the junction of The Reddings and North Road East has some significant damage. It is right by the roundabout as you are approaching from The Reddings (Aldi / Costa side). It has been that way for months now. Thank you,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Reddings, The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Visibility difficult due to grass verges overgrown, 3rd June
item.description:
Turning out of Langley Road onto the main B road either into Winchcombe or toward Prestbury is difficult due to the verges obstructing the view, please could they be trimmed back to assist?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langley Road, Winchcombe

item.title: Double dinner plate and very deep, 3rd June
item.description:
Right hand edge of road. Looks like a collapsed drain. Right near some black plastic fixed bollards which I suspect denote where a under-road storm drain exits or similar. Looks as if this has collapsed. Further up road erosion of road edge also needs surveying. Travel road every term-time day and noticed this morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked PROW , following ploughing, 3rd June
item.description:
The public footpath known as Coffin Footpath, between Bishops Cleeve and Gotherington is blocked once again following ploughing. The farmer does it every year and even ploughs right up to the hedgerows so there is no alternative route around the perimeter. Someone is going to be injured unless the footpath is restored. As a serial offender he should be fined.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coffin Path, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large 42 inch Pothole across one half of Manor Lane, 3rd June
item.description:
On Manor Lane, on the far end of the long stretch of lane that goes under the railway bridge. Top right, just before the lane curves to the left. There are 3-4 large potholes in succession on this part of the lane. I think they were previously circled in white but heavy rain removed the white markings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Lane, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear Sir Madam, Unless the tall grass that is blocking the visibility of the junctions on the A435 between Cirencester and Seven Springs are cut ASAP, I fear thereâ€™s going to be a fatal accident as the visibility on all the junctions , mostly situated on bends ,is virtually non existent., 3rd June
item.description:
